title: Ticket #373: the BLAHP and glite directory seem to be missing from the release
description:
The default condor config file shipped w/ Condor says: 

##
## Location of the PBS/LSF gahp and its associated binaries
##
GLITE_LOCATION = $(LIB)/glite
PBS_GAHP = $(GLITE_LOCATION)/bin/batch_gahp
LSF_GAHP = $(GLITE_LOCATION)/bin/batch_gahp

However, in the current tarball and the current RPM of Condor on the web, the "glite" directory cannot be found. Nor can the batch_gahp (blahp) binaries be found.

This should be fixed for future versions of Condor. In addition, please make the glite subdirectory available for ftp download for Steve Timm by the end of this week. He would like to setup Condor submissions into PBS in the short term.
remarks:
2009-Apr-09 11:38:12 by jfrey:
Which exact downloads was Steve Timm looking at? The BLAHP is included on only a small number of platforms at the moment.

2009-Apr-09 11:49:35 by jfrey:
Currently, the BLAHP is available on the following platforms:
  • linux-x86-rhel3
  • linux-x86-rhel5
  • linux-x86-debian40

Starting with the next release of Condor 7.3, the list will expand to most of our platforms.

2009-May-06 15:56:02 by jfrey:
The blahp/glite files are present in the tarballs we expect them in.
creator: tannenba
